What is the vision of the Verus community, and how does it differ from other decentralized platforms?

The Verus community envisions a decentralized future with unlimited scale, truth, and privacy for all. They focus on creation and innovation, rather than convincing others of their capabilities. Verus offers unique features that go beyond today's decentralized platforms, making it an exciting development in the crypto space.

As Verus PBaaS offers completely new capabilities that go beyond today’s decentralized platforms in many fundamental ways, the worldwide Verus community put its energy into creation, rather than convincing everyone that its capabilities are possible. Members across the Verus worldwide community have worked hard to make this all possible, and we are more than excited that you can now experience it firsthand. If you have an interest in the future of crypto, you owe it to yourself to learn about Verus, an unlimited scale, decentralized future with truth and privacy for all.## The Verus testnet, available in the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, has the following capabilities, which to our knowledge are unique in crypto today.## Self sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (currently on mainnet) VerusID - Enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable. ## Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault) - Enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user’s keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. Users may also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID as well. This enables virtually theft proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft. IDs may be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network. The VerusID protocol is a protocol, which can also be implemented on non-Verus systems. ## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming - Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. ## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets - Any ID owner may defin
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
What capabilities does the Verus testnet offer, and how do they stand out in the crypto space?

The Verus testnet, accessible through the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, offers several unique capabilities:

1. Self-sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (VerusID)
2. Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault)
3. Multi-currency, user-created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
4. Consensus-integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets

These capabilities are, to our knowledge, unique in crypto today.

What is Verus Vault, and how does it prevent theft?

Verus Vault is a staking-capable time locking and theft prevention mechanism that enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user's keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. This provides a virtually theft-proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the $5 wrench attack, and identity theft.
